hooks.prompt: Check if the Bash command that just ran contained 'trestle assemble', 'trestle import', 'trestle merge', 'trestle create', or 'trestle split'. If it did AND the command succeeded (exit code 0): For 'trestle assemble', 'trestle import', or 'trestle merge', remind the user: 'The assembled/imported/merged model should be validated. Run: trestle validate -t <type> -n <name>' — fill in the type and name from the command. For 'trestle create', remind the user: 'The new model has been created with REPLACE_ME placeholder values. Edit the model to fill in actual values, then validate.' For 'trestle split', remind the user: 'The model has been split into sub-component files for editing. After editing, recombine with: trestle merge -e <elements>' — suggest the appropriate merge command. If the command did NOT contain any of these trestle commands, do nothing and say nothing.
